<!-- **Are you in the right place?**
1. For issues or feature requests, please create an issue in this repository.
2. For general technical and non-technical questions, we are happy to help you on our [Rook.io Slack](https://slack.rook.io/).
3. Did you already search the existing open issues for anything similar? -->

**Is this a bug report or feature request?**
* Bug Report

**Deviation from expected behavior:**
Using the Erasure Coded example generates an invalid spec error due to missing "spec.dataPools.replicated.size in body should be greater than or equal to 1"
**Expected behavior:**
Should be able to specify an erasure coded data pool without specifying a replica size as in previous versions
**How to reproduce it (minimal and precise):**
<!-- Please let us know any circumstances for reproduction of your bug. -->
Create a cluster running latest version with the current CRDs and attempt to create a erasure coded cephfs as per https://rook.io/docs/rook/v1.2/ceph-filesystem-crd.html

Operator will report the following error: 

```
op-file: Unable to update the cephObjectStore myfs-ec status CephFilesystem.ceph.rook.io "myfs-ec" is invalid: []: Invalid value: map[string]interface {}{"apiVersion":"ceph.rook.io/v1", "kind":"CephFilesystem", "metadata":map[string]interface {}{"creationTimestamp":"2019-10-10T11:03:43Z", "generation":2, "name":"myfs-ec", "namespace":"rook-ceph", "resourceVersion":"9197692", "selfLink":"/apis/ceph.rook.io/v1/namespaces/rook-ceph/cephfilesystems/myfs-ec", "uid":"9fa6d1e8-eb4d-11e9-ac81-001a4a160102"}, "spec":map[string]interface {}{"dataPools":[]interface {}{map[string]interface {}{"crushRoot":"", "deviceClass":"", "erasureCoded":map[string]interface {}{"algorithm":"", "codingChunks":1, "dataChunks":2}, "failureDomain":"", "replicated":map[string]interface {}{"size":0}}}, "metadataPool":map[string]interface {}{"crushRoot":"", "deviceClass":"", "erasureCoded":map[string]interface {}{"algorithm":"", "codingChunks":0, "dataChunks":0}, "failureDomain":"", "replicated":map[string]interface {}{"size":3}}, "metadataServer":map[string]interface {}{"activeCount":1, "activeStandby":true, "placement":map[string]interface {}{}, "resources":map[string]interface {}{}}, "preservePoolsOnDelete":false}, "status":map[string]interface {}{"phase":"Ready"}}: validation failure list:
spec.dataPools.replicated.size in body should be greater than or equal to 1
```
**File(s) to submit**:

* Cluster CR (custom resource), typically called `cluster.yaml`, if necessary
* Operator's logs, if necessary
* Crashing pod(s) logs, if necessary

 To get logs, use `kubectl -n <namespace> logs <pod name>`
When pasting logs, always surround them with backticks or use the `insert code` button from the Github UI.
Read [Github documentation if you need help](https://help.github.com/en/articles/creating-and-highlighting-code-blocks).

**Environment**:
* OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): Red Hat Enterprise Linux CoreOS 42.81.20191210.1
* Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): 4.18.0-147.0.3.el8_1.x86_64
* Cloud provider or hardware configuration: Ovirt VMs
* Rook version (use `rook version` inside of a Rook Pod): 1.2.2
* Storage backend version (e.g. for ceph do `ceph -v`): ceph/ceph:v14.2.6-20200115
* Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): v1.14.6
* Kubernetes cluster type (e.g. Tectonic, GKE, OpenShift): OpenShift 4.2
* Storage backend status (e.g. for Ceph use `ceph health` in the [Rook Ceph toolbox](https://rook.io/docs/rook/master/ceph-toolbox.html)): HEALTH_OK
title: CephFS Erasure Coded CRD Conflict
